body:
The UK, and the Foreign and Commonwealth Office as a representative of the UK overseas, plays a critical role in demonstrating and promoting openness and transparency in government. 

The UK is one of eight founding members of the Open Government Partnership (OGP), an initiative now signed by over 70 countries around the world. However there is still much to do to realise the vision set out by the pillars of the partnership.

This module explores the pillars of the OGP, the critical role of open data in each pillar and how the UK is pushing the 'open by default' agenda.
displayTitle: 1. Openness and transparency in the FCO
title: 1. Openness and transparency in the FCO

_skills.outcome: List the pillars of an open government
Explain the importance of open data in an open government
Explain the role of the FCO in supporting open governments both in the UK and overseas

body:
The FCO is committed to open data. The department has published its commitments to publishing open data, and its Open Data Strategy which outlines some of the high priority datasets including those related to aid, consular services and spending.

The FCO currently makes use of both open and shared datasets for its internal activities, however challenges still exist in realising the benefits of a strong data strategy within the department.

This module looks at why data should be treated as a valuable raw resource and how a strong data strategy can help maximise benefits both internally and externally.
displayTitle: 2. The role of data in the FCO
title: 2. The role of data in the FCO

_skills.outcome: Explain the difference between data and information
Explain the benefits of publishing open data to the FCO
Identify current examples of open data publication at the FCO
Analyse the opportunities and challenges of publishing open data

body:
Publishing sustainable open data helps to improve the reputation of the publisher as a reliable provider of timely, usable and interoperable open data.

This module explores the steps to publishing open data, the importance of licensing data and how to make open data publications more sustainable.
displayTitle: 3.  Getting started with publishing sustainable open data
title: 3.  Getting started with publishing sustainable open data

_skills.outcome: List the steps to publishing open data
Explain the importance of licensing open data
Explain the importance of sustainability for open data
Describe how to make your data more sustainable
Describe how to embed sustainability in your organisation

body:
Without timely, reliable and quality data, we can't inform decisions, provide evidence for statements or build new products and services.

In this module we explore how to improve data quality, from cleaning data to reduce errors, to using a standard to make data more interoperable.
title: 4. Improving the quality of data

_skills.outcome: List tools to help clean a dataset
Explain the role of standards in improving quality
Describe two quality marques for open data
